title: High school computers can't reliably log in to play
body:
So i started coaching a league of legends team for my local highschool and our biggest hiccup is that we can't reliably log in to the client and play, we can make it to the login screen but frequently (not always) get the attempting to login notice and failure to find the server, when we try to log in through the website the login page fails to load every time.

this doesn't happen to everyone (it feels like people log in by pure luck) but it makes it really difficult to log in and play as 5, anybody might know whats going on here? maybe the schools firewall is causing the problem

replies.body:
It's very likely the school's firewall is causing the problem, as most campus firewalls aren't specifically optimized for connecting you to the League servers. I recommend reaching out to your Network Administrator and ensure they've allowed data to flow through the ports listed in [**this guide.**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq8)

Let me know if you have any questions.
thank you! i'll reach out to you tmro when im at the school and make stuff happen

good luck! Most schools have firewalls specifically TO stop people from playing things like League of legends.
Plus the connection is going to SUCK
I think in this case because he's bringing a community together to play League (coaching a team), they would find it acceptable.
I agree, but from a school stand point, this stuff is blocked by higher ups and you need to do a lot to get that kind of permission to bypass firewalls.
